intro: Tetrastigma littorale, commonly known as the coastal or coastal climbing vine, is a member of the Vitaceae family. It is a woody vine that typically grows in coastal areas, often on rocky substrates or in humid environments. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Tetrastigma littorale is adapted to saline and tidal conditions, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
